item.title: LTFRB opens 44 more routes, allows 4,820 more jeepneys in Metro Manila
item.description: The Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board (LTFRB) has opened 44 more routes and allowed 4,820 more public utility jeepney (PUJ) units to operate in Metro Manila.

item.title: Bangkay ng lalaki, natagpuang nakahalo sa basura sa tabing ilog sa QC
item.description: Isang bangkay ng isang lalaki ang natagpuan kasama ng mga inanod na basura sa tabing-ilog sa Quezon City, ayon sa ulat ni Mai Bermudez sa Unang Balita nitong Martes.

item.title: Worldwide coronavirus cases reach 37.68M, death toll at 1,077,858 --Reuters tally
item.description: More than 37.68 million people have been reported to be infected by the novel coronavirus globally and 1,077,858 have died, according to a Reuters tally.

item.title: Trump tests negative for COVID-19, is not infectious - White House physician
item.description: US President Donald Trump has tested negative for COVID-19 and he is not infectious to others, the White House physician said on Monday, 10 days after Trump announced he had contracted the coronavirus.

item.title: Peru opens Machu Picchu for one Japanese tourist after almost 7-month wait
item.description: Peru opened the ruins of Machu Picchu for a single Japanese tourist after he waited almost seven months to enter the Inca citadel, while trapped in the Andean country during the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: US coronavirus expert Fauci says Trump campaign ad should be taken down
item.description: Top US infectious diseases expert Anthony Fauci said on Monday that President Donald Trump's campaign team should take down an advertisement that draws on a public statement Fauci made that he says is being used out of context.

item.title: Pope meets Australian Cardinal Pell in midst of money scandal
item.description: Pope Francis met on Monday with Australian Cardinal George Pell, the Vatican's former economy minister who has returned to Rome after the firing of an Italian cardinal whom Pell had accused of obstructing financial reform.

item.title: Vatican to open refugee reception center in Rome
item.description: A building in Rome owned by a convent will be used as a reception center for up to 60 asylum seekers, the chaplain responsible for the Vatican's charitable works announced Monday.

item.title: Letting virus 'run free' to gain herd immunity 'unethical' - WHO
item.description: The World Health Organization (WHO) chief warned Monday against just allowing the new coronavirus to spread in the hope of achieving so-called herd immunity, saying it was "unethical".

item.title: Cardinal Tagle back to work in Rome
item.description: Cardinal Luis Antonio Tagle is back to his work in the Vatican after a month-long visit in the country, according to a report posted on the Catholic Bishops' Conference of the Philippines (CBCP) website.

item.title: 17 families evacuated in Tagbilaran City, Bohol after heavy rains
item.description: At least 17 families were evacuated due to flooding in parts of Tagbilaran City in Bohol on Sunday evening.

item.title: DepEd, pinaalalahanan ang mga guro na 'wag tambakan ng trabaho ang mga estudyante
item.description: Pinaalalahanan ng Department of Education (DepEd) ang mga guro na tantsahin lang at huwag tambakan ng gawain ang mga estudyante ngayong "blended learning" ang paraan ng pagtuturo dahil sa pandemic.

item.title: The Cayetano-Velasco speakership row
item.description: The speakership row between Marinduque Representative Lord Allan Velasco and Taguig-Pateros Representative Alan Peter Cayetano has been landing headlines for around four weeks now as the House deliberated on the proposed 2021 national budget.

item.title: Bohol gov't reports 12 new COVID-19 cases
item.description: Twelve new cases of novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19) were recorded in Bohol province, Bohol Governor Arthur Yap said.

item.title: Appropriations chair readies two scenarios for House budget proceedings
item.description: "Yung isa naka-tailor-made kung ibabalik ng second reading which is 'yun yung sinasabi lagi ni Speaker Velasco. Yung isa naman naka-tailor-made kay Speaker Cayetano na we will push through with third reading," Yap said.
